title: 'We were walking in blood': Iran's doctors recount crackdown on protesters
subhead: From crowded emergency rooms to apocalyptic scenes in Iranian cities, healthcare workers told Le Monde about the violence that descended on protesters calling for the end of the Iranian regime from January 8.

title: Ukraine, Russia hold first direct talks on latest US peace plan
French PM survives two no-confidence votes over disputed budget
An era of distrust emerges between the US and its Western allies
subhead: Donald Trump's suggestion that the US could seize Greenland by force has exposed the strategic isolation his administration has chosen, in disregard for the country's commitments. Even though the Republican president abandoned the idea at Davos, the damage to US credibility is substantial.

title: After Trump's retreat over Greenland, Europeans want to believe in their unity
subhead: Shaken by the unpredictability of the American president, the 27 member states declared at an extraordinary summit in Brussels on Thursday that they had learned lessons from the crisis, which saw them prepared to deploy the Anti-Coercion Instrument.

title: Fewer French tourists are traveling to the US
subhead: Purchasing power, political climate: The number of French people traveling to the US dropped by 7% in 2025, though overall volumes remain high. For certain nationalities, there were even steeper declines: Germans dropped by 12%, and Canadians by 22%.

title: 'The success of books by French politicians like Sarkozy and Bardella creates a dilemma for booksellers'
subhead: Books by right and far-right figures have been racking up extraordinary sales. Critics are divided over whether the current literary landscape reflects growing conservatism among French voters, observes Le Monde columnist Michel Guerrin.

title: US strike on alleged drug-smuggling boat kills two in Pacific
France's health minister says all potentially contaminated baby formula has been 'withdrawn' from market
Six weeks before the Louvre heist, the Paris Police Prefecture warned about security risks
Cocaine lab explosion kills seven in Colombia
How Ubisoft, the French video game giant, hit breaking point after years of turmoil
Confusion over closure of France's Bétharram Catholic school after abuse scandal
France probes seized oil tanker thought to be part of Russian shadow fleet
The RN's unspoken attraction to MAGA – and gradual ideological alignment
Spanish train disaster probe suggests faulty track caused derailment
At Davos, Trump revives 'Middle East Riviera' fantasies in Gaza
Rights group confirms over 5,000 killed during Iran protests
French say they love art, but rarely visit exhibitions
'As it ceases to inspire, the US is losing part of itself'
subhead: Donald Trump's second term has turned the United States into a threat to which the rest of the world has no choice but to adapt. Yet, over the past eight decades, habits and practices have taken root that will be used to counter this new imperialism, writes Le Monde columnist Gilles Paris.

title: Is it ever a good idea to... wear aviator sunglasses (when you're Emmanuel Macron)?
subhead: In fashion, as in life, it is important to know the lines you should not cross. Or else, to do so deliberately.

title: France prepares for unpredictable municipal elections, one year before presidential vote
subhead: Local officials fear the national political crisis will have a ripple effect on the upcoming municipal elections in March. Three-way and four-way runoffs are expected to be widespread, paving the way for political realignments just months before the crucial 2027 presidential contest.

title: France's low-emission zones fall victim to a shortsighted political class
A 'Board of Peace,' to do what?
France's Parliament must be protected from the fever of the presidential election
